job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: <p>Are you looking to join a ground-floor startup where your work makes an immediate impact?</p><p><br></p><p>Do you want to be a part of a dynamic team with diverse backgrounds improving benefit offerings and the experience for employees?</p><p><br></p><p>Do you want to be a part of the discussion and impact decisions that shape the future of the company you work for?</p><p><br></p><p>Our ideal candidate is a self-motivated problem solver who thrives in an open and collaborative environment. You enjoy supporting and developing an application that will re-invent itself as and scale with market adaptation.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Day to Day Responsibilities</strong></p><ul><li>Writing clean, high-quality, high-performance, maintainable code</li><li>Develop and support software including applications, database integration, interfaces, and new functionality enhancements</li><li>Design robust, secure, and scalable features</li><li>Coordinate cross-functionally to insure project meets business objectives and compliance standards</li><li>Support, test, and deployment of new products and features</li><li>Participate in code reviews</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or related field) Extensive Experience in software engineering considered in lieu of degree.</li><li>2+ years of Ruby on Rails development experience</li><li>Experience working with relational databases, MySQL preferred</li><li>Expertise in front end technologies (e.g., JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and JQuery)</li><li>Experience with Agile or Scrum software development methodologies</li><li>An analytical mind in addition to a problem-solving attitude</li><li>Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work</li></ul>
